quotes.quote: Two conspirators with a frog, following the line of a whiffletree.
A frog in a well cannot conceive of the ocean.
Don't be a fish; be a frog. Swim in the water and jump when you hit ground.
Frogs have it made, they get to eat what bugs them.
We are born princes and the civilizing process makes us frogs.
Style, is like a frog: you can dissect the thing, but it somehow dies in the process.
Frog in the mud is happier than the man, because it has no ambition to reach the stars!
There is no place in a city that can't be better. There is no toad that can't be a princess, no frog that can't become a prince.
The frog does not run in the daytime for nothing.
If a frog becomes a king, he will make the whole kingdom muddy!
If you were called to gallop like the horse, never end up hopping like the frog. Rise up for greatness.
I'd rather be ignored as a frog than eaten as a human.
Frog in a little pond can be much happier than fish in a vast ocean!
Like a frog, the aphorist waits for something to fly by that he can catch with his tongue.
I'd kiss a frog even if there was no promise of a Prince Charming popping out of it. I love frogs.
It wasn't a kiss that changed the frog, but the fact that a young girl looked beneath warts and slime and believed she saw a prince. So he became one.
You have to kiss a lot of frogs before you find your prince.
Kiss a frog with your eyes wide open. If he turns into a prince you won't miss the transformation, but if he doesn't, you won't be fooled by some wishful illusion in your head.
The frog croaks loud, and maidens dare not pass but fear the noisome toad and shun the grass.
I wish you were a frog you could change with just a kiss to brace you will make me toad I could fill pails with tears.
Be kind and tender to the Frog and do not call him names.
The Frog is justly sensitive to epithets like these. No animal will more repay a treatment kind and fair. At least so lonely people say who keep a frog (and, by the way,they are extremely rare).
Bull father frog was on the log. While many a little fellow around the pool. Upon his stool sat learning how to bellow.
A huge frog and I, staring at each other, neither of us moves.
